rows.name: Projection
rows.description: Tilesets in non-Web Mercator projections are supported. The Projections Tab enables the configuration of a new projection for the given mission. All tilesets should be in agreement with the projection. Small issues with the settings here can have huge impacts on how the tilesets are rendered in MMGIS.

components.name: Enabled
components.description: Enable to use the projection defined below instead of the default Web-Mercator.

components.name: EPSG Code
components.description: An EPSG (or similar) code representing the spatial reference system. See https://spatialreference.org/ref/epsg/ for examples. For instance: 'IAU2000:30120'

components.name: Proj4 (v2.3.14) String
components.description: A Proj4 String that defines the projection. See https://proj.org/en/9.4/operations/projections/index.html for examples. Here is an example value of a lunar south-pole stereographic proj4 string: '+proj=stere +lat_0=-90 +lon_0=0 +k=1 +x_0=0 +y_0=0 +a=1737400 +b=1737400 +units=m +no_defs'

components.name: Path to Basemap tilemapresource.xml
components.description: Set the path to the tilemapresource.xml that was created with the base (and global) tileset. Used only to help auto-populate the remaining projection values below.

components.name: Bounds Min X
components.description: Minimum easting value of the projection's spatial extent as stated by the base global tilemapresource.xml.

components.name: Bounds Min Y
components.description: Minimum northing value of the projection's spatial extent as stated by the base global tilemapresource.xml.

components.name: Bounds Max X
components.description: Maximum easting value of the projection's spatial extent as stated by the base global tilemapresource.xml.

components.name: Bounds Max Y
components.description: Maximum northing value of the projection's spatial extent as stated by the base global tilemapresource.xml.

components.name: Origin X
components.description: Origin easting of the projection

components.name: Origin Y
components.description: Origin northing of the projection

components.name: At zoom level...
components.description: A zoom level from the tilemapresource.xml to combine with the following units-per-pixel. Most often this can be set to a zoom level of '0'.

components.name: ... the units per pixel are
components.description: Based on the zoom level defined before and the tilemapresource.xml, the respective units-per-pixel to set the scaling of the projection.

rows.name: Displayed Coordinates
rows.description: Configure which coordinates are made visible to users when mousing around and exporting vectors.

components.name: Enabled
components.description: Check to display Longitude, Latitude coordinates to users. This is the default main coordinate type.

components.name: Enabled
components.description: Check to display Easting, Northing coordinates to users. These coordinates are always in a mercator projection and can be manipulated with the input boxes below. Use Primary or Secondary Projection if you need Easting, Northing in another projection.

components.name: Enabled
components.description: Check to display Easting, Northing coordinates calculated via proj4 and the projection defined in the Projection Tab. If no projection is specified in the Projection Tab, this setting becomes ignored.

components.name: Display Name
components.description: Optionally set a Display Name to aid users in identifying the projection.

components.name: Enabled
components.description: See Primary Projection, however any proj4 string may be entered here to convert coordinates to and without modifying the Map's underlying projection.

components.name: Display Name
components.description: Optionally set a Display Name to aid users in identifying the projection.

components.name: Enabled
components.description: Check to display X, Y, Z coordinates to users relative to point features they highlight. If no point feature is highlighted, X, Y, Z coordinates will be relative to the Map's origin.

components.name: Enabled
components.description: Check to display Y, X, -Z coordinates to users relative to point features they highlight. If no point feature is highlighted, Y, X, -Z coordinates will be relative to the Map's origin.

rows.name: Elevation
rows.description: Configure the inclusion of elevation coordinates.

components.name: Enabled
components.description: Check to query for and append elevation values to the lower-right coordinates as users mouse around. DEM URL must be set.

components.name: DEM URL
components.description: The path to the mission's base DEM to query elevation values off of.

rows.name: Right Click Menu Actions
rows.description: Configures the available functionalities of the Map's and Globe's right-click context menu.

components.name: Context Menu Actions
components.description: When right-clicking on the Map or Globe, a custom context-menu appears. By default it only offers 'Copy Coordinates'. By adding objects to the rightClickMenuActions array, entries can be added to the context-menu to send users to links with parameters populated with the current coordinates.

object.name: Name
object.description: The text for this menu entry when users right-click.

object.name: Link
object.description:
A url template. Curly brackets are included. The available coordinate parameters (with array index in brackets and assuming they are enabled) are:
ll: [longitude, latitude, elevation] - Longitude Latitude
en: [easting, northing, elevation] - Easting Northing
cproj: [easting, northing, elevation] - Projected
sproj: [easting, northing, elevation] - Secondary Projected
rxy: [x, y, z] - Relative
site: [y, x, -z] - Local Level
Examples include:
'https://domain?I={ll[0]}&will={ll[1]}&replace={ll[2]}&these={en[0]}&brackets={en[1]}&for={cproj[0]}&you={sproj[0]}&with={rxy[0]}&coordinates={site[2]}'
'https://domain?regularWKT={wkt}&wkt_where_commas_are_replaced_with_underscores={wkt_}'

object.name: For
object.description: Optionally restrict some right-click menu actions to only be supported when clicking on a polygon.

object.name: Goto
object.description: Whether to, upon clicking the action in the context menu, pan and zoom to fit the respective feature to the screen.
